intro: Asplundia insignis, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), and it produces small, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
